corpus

Class Corpus

  • java.lang.Object
    • corpus.Corpus

  • public class Corpus
extends java.lang.Object
    An object that maps all the word French to vector. A Corpus cannot contain duplicate words; each words can map to at most one vector.

    This class will read a file vecs50 in order to get all the words and its vectors

    The Corpus class provides one factory method , which allow user to get a corpus from a file. There are no constructor for users.

    Since:
    1.0

        Gets the number of words in the corpus

      • putWord

        public void putWord(java.lang.String word,
                    Vector vect)
        Associates the specified vector with the specified word in this corpus (optional operation). If the map previously contained a mapping for the key, the old value is replaced by the specified value.
        Parameters:
        word - word with which the specified vector is to be associated
        vect - vector to be associated with the specified word

      • getVector

        public Vector getVector(java.lang.String word)
                 throws WordNotFoundException
        Returns the vector to which the specified word is mapped.

        More formally, if this corpus contains a mapping from a word to a vector, then this method returns its vector; otherwise it will throw a WordNotFoundException.

        Parameters:
        word - the word whose associated vector is to be returned
        Returns:
        the vector to which the specified word is mapped.
        Throws:
        WordNotFoundException - if the word is not in corpus.
        java.lang.NullPointerException - if the specified word is null and this corpus does not permit null keys

      • getSimilarWord

        public java.util.List<java.util.Map.Entry<java.lang.Double,java.lang.String>> getSimilarWord(Vector vect,
                                                                                             int size)
        Returns the most similar words with specified vector and its correlation coefficient.

        This method will calculate the cosine similarity between the specified vector and each word in corpus.It can return a specified number of similar word.These mappings from a similarity to a word will save in a map.

        Parameters:
        vect - the reference vector with which to compare.
        size - the number of similar words which to return
        Returns:
        a mapping sorted by the similarity containing the specified number of mappings from a similarity to a word

      • getSimilarWord

        public java.util.List<java.util.Map.Entry<java.lang.Double,java.lang.String>> getSimilarWord(java.lang.String word,
                                                                                             int size)
                                                                                      throws WordNotFoundException
        Returns the most similar words with specified word and its correlation coefficient.

        This method will calculate the cosine similarity between the specified word and each word in corpus.It can return a specified number of similar word.These mappings from a similarity to a word will save in a map.

        Parameters:
        word - the reference word with which to compare.
        size - the number of similar words which to return
        Returns:
        a mapping sorted by the similarity containing the specified number of mappings from a similarity to a word, Or null if the word doesn't exist in the corpus.
        Throws:
        WordNotFoundException - if the word is not in corpus.
